channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Banks Sue Federal Reserve Over 'Lack of Transparency' in Stress Testing
item.description: The Fed on Monday said it planned to overhaul the stress-test regime for banks and planned to seek public comment on planned changes.

item.title: Federal Reserve proposes more transparency in bank stress tests, but banks still sue
item.description: Trade groups representing the largest U.S. banks on Tuesday filed suit in federal court to force more transparency in the U.S. Federal Reserve’s bank ...

item.title: My friend has a dependent son, 32, who drives without car insurance. Would his parents be criminally liable if he has an accident?
item.description: “They declare him as a dependent for tax purposes.”

item.title: Sterling Loses Some of Its Shine
item.description: Sterling was up slightly against the dollar in early trade, but is no longer the best-performing G-10 currency in 2024, driven into second place by th...

item.title: Gold Futures Slip Slightly in Slow Holiday Trading
item.description: Gold futures slipped slightly amid low holiday trading volumes, reversing earlier gains.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Gain in Quiet Trade
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures are higher in light trade, with participants focused on weather forecasts suggesting strong heating demand for January.

item.title: Lumps of coal for Wall Street money managers — again
item.description: Once again, you were better off buying the assets on Wall Street that were the most hated by the big-money crowd than the assets that were most loved.

item.title: ‘She has two financially stable children’: Does it make sense for my wealthy mother, a recent widow, to take out a $100,000 life-insurance policy?
item.description: “It was generous of our mom to offer.”

item.title: ‘I worked hard for my savings’: I’m 71 and a retired teacher. I want to give my kids money — but my daughter spends lavishly and my son is wealthy.
item.description: “I have been reading about the idea of giving your children money when they need it the most, rather than waiting until you die.”

item.title: Stocks Steady to Start Short Christmas Eve Trading Session
item.description: U.S. stocks rose, in a holiday-shortened pre-Christmas trading session with all three major indexes gaining for the third trading day in a row.
